    • updateGUIAtBeginningOfGame

      public void updateGUIAtBeginningOfGame(TilePlacingSpot[][] board, Map<Integer,PersonalGoalCard> pgcMap, PersonalGoalCard pgc, List<CommonGoalCard> cgcs, List<Player> leaderboard, String isPlaying)
      This method updates the GUI showing game's first turn board, PersonalGoalCard, CommonGoalCards and leaderbaord
      Parameters:
      board - The game board
      pgcMap - The map of personal goal cards containing the valid tiles for comparison.
      pgc - The player's personal goal card
      cgcs - The list of common goal cards
      leaderboard - the list of players that are playing
      isPlaying - nickname of the player who is currently playing

    • setCloseAlert

      public void setCloseAlert()
      This method is used to display an alert when the player wants to close the GameScene window and checks if the player wants to exit the game. If the player wants to end the game he will click the OK button in the alert and the player will quit the game.

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard(TilePlacingSpot[][] grid)
      Replaces the scene's board tiles with grid[][] tiles. Each tile has a EventHandler for MouseEvent to handle tile selection.
      Parameters:
      grid - - game board

    • createLeaderboard

      public void createLeaderboard(List<Player> leaderboard)
      This method creates the leaderboard as a table with 2 columns: one for the player nickname and the other for their scores. The leaderboard is always sorted in decreasing points.
      Parameters:
      leaderboard - the list of player who are playing and their scores

    • createShelfButtons

      private void createShelfButtons()
      This method is used th set Shelf Buttons visible when the green check has been pressed and the player has to insert the tiles in the shelf.

    • drawTilesFromRMIServer

      public void drawTilesFromRMIServer()
      This method draws tiles from the RMI server and updates the game board. Retrieves the necessary parameters from the GUI and checks if the drawn tiles are on the same row or column. It sorts the list of positions accordingly and determines the direction in which the tiles should be placed on the game board. The method then calls the RMI server's drawTilesFromBoard(int, int, int, Board.Direction) method to draw the tiles and updates the game board accordingly. If the draw operation is successful, the shelf buttons pane is made visible on the GUI.

    • checkIfTileCanBeDrawn

      private boolean checkIfTileCanBeDrawn(Position p)
      this method is used to check wether a tile can be drawn from the board (is on the same row/column of the other drawn tiles, is drawable according to game rules)
      Parameters:
      p - it's the position of the tile in the board that we want to draw
      Returns:
      true if the tile is drawable, false otherwise

      Parameters:

    • checkIfTileIsDrawable

      private boolean checkIfTileIsDrawable(Position p)
      This method is used to check if the tile in position p on the board is drawable according to the game rules (it must have at least one side free)
      Parameters:
      p - position of the tile on which we are doing the control
      Returns:
      true if the tile is drawable, false otherwise

    • getNodeAt

      private javafx.scene.Node getNodeAt(int row, int column, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
      This method is used to get the Node in position (x, y) in the gridpane
      Parameters:
      row - row of the element
      column - column of the element
      gridPane - gridpane in which we look for the node
      Returns:
      null if the position (x,y) is empty in gridPane, otherwise it returns the node in that position

    • runGameSceneThreads

      public void runGameSceneThreads()
      Creates threads to run updateGUIIfGameHasStarted and socketUpdateGUI

    • socketInitializeGameScene

      public void socketInitializeGameScene()
      Used by socket to wait for server notification that game has started. When it has, updateGUIAtBeginningOfGame is called.

    • socketUpdateGameScene

      public void socketUpdateGameScene()
      This method updates the game scene via socket communication. This method runs in a separate thread and continuously updates the game scene based on incoming data received via socket communication. It synchronizes access to ensure that the updateGameScene method is not executed simultaneously with the socketInitializeGameScene() method. The method waits for the turn to end, and upon receiving the notification, updates the game scene with the current state of the board, leaderboard, and shelf. If the game ends, it triggers the switch to the end game scene by passing the leaderboard data. Additionally, if the connection is lost, it navigates back to the login screen by calling the backToLogin() method.

    • setPlayerLabels

      public void setPlayerLabels()

    • socketMessageTextArea

      public void socketMessageTextArea()
      This method is called in MatchTypeController and in LoginSceneController when the switch to GameScene is called to show incoming messages to the player in messageTextArea

    • chatButtonPressed

      public void chatButtonPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws RemoteException
      this method is called once chat button is pressed, if clientSocket != null it sends the chat message through method clientSpeaker otherwise it means the player is using RMI so the message is sent through method sendChatMessage
      Parameters:
      e - : chatButton clicked event
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • socketHandleCheckmarkButton

      private void socketHandleCheckmarkButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Sends socket server a request to draw the selected tiles. It mimics input from CLI. Sets shelfButtonsPane to visible, draws tiles from board.

    • socketHandleShelfButton

      private void socketHandleShelfButton(String column)
      This method sends server the selected column and information about reordering drawn tiles.
      Parameters:
      column - the column sent to the server in which tiles have to be inserted.

    • updateScoringTokens

      public void updateScoringTokens(List<ScoringToken> tokens)
      This method is used to update the view of the scoring token of the player
      Parameters:
      tokens - list of the scoring tokens

    • updateCommonGoalCardTokens

      public void updateCommonGoalCardTokens(int n, List<ScoringToken> tokens)
      this method is used for updating the view of the tokens of a certain common goal
      Parameters:
      n - 1 if the common goal to be updated is the first one, 2 if it is the second one
      tokens - list of the scoring token to add the view

    • setEndGameToken

      public void setEndGameToken()
      This method is udes to set the End Game token to the player that has received it in his scene

    • rmiMessageTextArea

      public void rmiMessageTextArea(String message)
      This method is called by ClientNotificationRMIGUI receiveMessage to show incoming messages to the player in messageTextArea
      Parameters:
      message - is the message received by the client from the server

    • switchToEndGameScene

      public void switchToEndGameScene(List<Player> leaderboard)
      This method is called to load the EndGameScene when the game has ended.
      Parameters:
      leaderboard - : the game leaderboard used to show the game results.

    • backToLogin

      public void backToLogin()
      This method is used to return to the LogIn scene.This method switches the application's scene to the login scene, allowing the user to log in again. It loads the "LoginScene.fxml" file, sets the necessary controller and client, and displays the new scene in a new stage. Additionally, it handles the close request of the stage by exiting the platform when the close button is pressed.

    • chatSetUp

      public void chatSetUp()
      This method sets up the chat interface. This method configures the chat interface by making the necessary components visible and setting an initial message. It shows the message text area, sets the welcome message, and makes the chat button and text field visible for user interaction. The chat interface allows users to send messages and engage in conversations with others.

    • close

      public void close()

    • setFirstPlayerSeat

      public void setFirstPlayerSeat()
      This method is used to set the first player seat only in the scene of the player who has the first player seat.
